metadata.original_query:
Show me the latest innovations in Weatherability of Decorative Coatings. What trends are emerging in the Sustainability of industrial coatings in 2025? Find recent conferences or Patents discussing Scuff-Resistance in coatings.

Search tags/topics - Product, coating, architectural or similar.

Datasources/URLs (https://www.paint.org/ , https://www.coatingsworld.com/ , https://www.pcimag.com/ )

News.title: Dutch Boy Paints Introduces New and Improved Platinum Plus
News.summary: Dutch Boy Paints has launched an enhanced version of its Platinum Plus paint, now featuring a new Anti-Scuff formula in addition to its existing Stain-Shield technology. This architectural coating is designed to offer a luxurious, durable, and highly scrubbable finish, providing increased protection against daily wear and tear, making it ideal for high-traffic areas in homes. The improved formula aims to deliver the performance of luxury paints at an accessible price point. According to Julie Fisher, a product manager at Dutch Boy Paints, the upgrade is part of the company's commitment to simplifying the painting process and meeting evolving consumer needs by ensuring walls maintain their appearance over time. The product is now also available in a new matte sheen, which offers a subtle shine and helps conceal minor surface imperfections. The enhanced Platinum Plus paint is sold exclusively at Menards and comes in the brand's unique Twist & Pour container, which is designed for ease of handling and pouring.

News.title: PPG Publishes 2024 Sustainability Report, Marking Progress Against 2030 Targets
News.summary: PPG has released its 2024 Sustainability Report, detailing significant progress toward its 2030 environmental, social, and governance (ESG) goals. A key highlight is that 41% of the company's sales are now derived from sustainably advantaged products. The company has achieved an 18% reduction in its own operational greenhouse gas emissions (scope 1 and 2), partly through renewable energy projects like the solar installation at its Caivano, Italy facility, which cuts annual CO2 emissions by approximately 390 metric tons. Furthermore, PPG has recorded a 6% reduction in value chain emissions (scope 3) and is now reusing, recycling, or recovering 48% of its process waste. Water intensity at sites in water-stressed areas has been reduced by 28%. The report also notes that 98% of PPG's key suppliers have been assessed against sustainability and social responsibility criteria.

News.title: 2025 CEO Forum: Coatings Leaders on 2024 Performance and 2025 Outlook
News.summary: In the 2025 CEO Forum, leaders from top global coatings companies including AkzoNobel, BASF, and Hempel shared insights on market performance and future strategies. The consensus for 2024 was a year of mixed results and varied regional performance, impacted by global macroeconomic instability, fluctuating mortgage rates, and geopolitical tensions. While some sectors like automotive saw declines, others such as marine, protective, and specific decorative markets in Latin America and Southeast Asia showed robust growth. For 2025, most leaders expressed cautious optimism, not anticipating a significant market rebound but focusing on strategic growth. Key growth areas identified include sustainable and eco-friendly coatings (water-based, bio-based), products for the green energy sector (EV batteries, solar panels), and construction chemicals. R&D efforts are heavily concentrated on sustainability-driven innovation, nanotechnology, and developing climate-resilient coatings. Business strategies for the coming year are centered on operational efficiency, cost management through technology, portfolio optimization, and expanding distribution networks, particularly in emerging markets.

News.title: Best Practices for Crisis and Disaster Response in Chemical Distribution
News.summary: The chemical distribution industry faces a dynamic environment characterized by evolving regulations and market consolidation. This article explores the challenges and opportunities in this landscape, emphasizing the need for robust crisis and disaster response strategies to ensure business continuity and safety. It covers best practices for preparing for unexpected events and navigating the complexities of the modern supply chain for coatings and chemical materials.

News.title: Carboxylic-Functional Ultramatte Binders for 2K Coatings
News.summary: A new carboxylic-functional ultramatte binder has been developed for two-component (2K) coating systems. This technology offers significant improvements in durability, self-healing properties, and environmental performance. The summary highlights its potential as a breakthrough in matte coating technology, providing enhanced aesthetics and functionality for various applications in the coatings industry. The development was led by Dr. Andr√© Derksen, Sara Roig, Francisco Chico, and Joan Parareda.

News.title: Innovative Approaches to Water-Based DTM Coatings
News.summary: This article discusses the formulation challenges of water-based direct-to-metal (DTM) coatings. It focuses on the innovative use of resin and additive combinations to improve adhesion, corrosion resistance, and overall durability. The summary emphasizes the technical strategies required to overcome the inherent difficulties in formulating high-performance water-based DTM systems for the protection of metallic substrates.

News.title: Fast-Cure, Flexible, and EHS-Friendly Epoxy Coatings
News.summary: A new generation of epoxy coatings is presented that features fast cure times, high flexibility, and an improved Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) profile. These benefits are achieved without sacrificing key performance properties such as tensile strength and adhesion. The summary highlights the significance of this development for applications requiring rapid turnaround and reduced environmental impact.

News.title: Eliminating VOCs with High-Efficiency UV Coatings
News.summary: A case study of a leading tube producer's transition to UV coatings is presented. This shift resulted in the complete elimination of Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs), along with faster production speeds and reduced remediation costs. The summary underscores the dual benefits of enhanced environmental compliance and improved return on investment (ROI) achievable with UV coating technology.

News.title: Data and Dynamics of the Global Paint and Coatings Industry
News.summary: This article explores new data that reveals shifting regional demand patterns, the growing impact of sustainability, and key sector trends that are shaping the future of the global paint and coatings industry. The summary focuses on the market intelligence provided, offering insights into the forces driving innovation and change across the international coatings landscape.

News.title: Two Decades of Innovation in Graphene-Enhanced Coatings
News.summary: Over the past 20 years, graphene has emerged as a revolutionary material in the coatings industry. This article reviews the innovations it has enabled, including significant enhancements in corrosion resistance, durability, conductivity, and sustainability. The summary emphasizes how graphene is paving the way for the development of next-generation, high-performance coating formulations.

News.title: Advanced Technologies for the Global Paint & Coatings Market
News.summary: This article explores the new frontiers in the global paint and coatings market, driven by advanced technologies. Key developments discussed include self-healing paints and solvent-free formulations, which are shaping the future of sustainable, high-performance applications. The summary, based on BCC Research, highlights the innovative trends and their impact on the industry.

News.title: High-Speed Floor Mount Dispersers for Viscous Materials
News.summary: A new line of floor-mounted dispersers has been introduced for mixing viscous materials in batches up to 200 gallons. These high-speed dispersers are designed to provide efficient and effective mixing for a variety of demanding applications in the coatings and related industries.

News.title: New Waterborne Base Coat Reduces Application Time
News.summary: A new waterborne base coat technology has been launched that can cut application time by 50%. This is achieved through a single-cycle paint booth process, which also contributes to reduced energy costs and lower emissions. The summary highlights the efficiency and environmental benefits of this new coating system for industrial applications.

News.title: New Micronized Yellow Pigments with Reduced Carbon Footprint
News.summary: A new range of micronized yellow pigments has been developed for high-end paint and coatings applications. These pigments are designed with a focus on sustainability, offering a reduced carbon footprint compared to conventional alternatives. The summary emphasizes the combination of performance and environmental responsibility these new pigments provide.

News.title: New Solvent-Based Urethane Coating with Enhanced Durability
News.summary: A new solvent-based urethane coating has been introduced that offers high dielectric strength, superior color retention, and easy application. This coating is formulated for enhanced durability, making it suitable for a range of demanding protective and decorative applications where performance and aesthetics are critical.

News.title: Emerging Terahertz Technology Improves Coating Quality
News.summary: A new robotic solution utilizing terahertz technology is set to revolutionize automotive and aerospace manufacturing. This emerging technology allows for precision measurements down to 1 micron, which can eliminate paint waste and significantly improve coating quality. The article discusses the potential of this innovation to enhance efficiency and quality control in high-tech manufacturing sectors.

News.title: Advantages of Siloxane Surface Additives in Low-VOC Architectural Coatings
News.summary: This technical article by researchers from Evonik Corporation, published in the January-February 2024 issue of CoatingsTech, details the benefits of using siloxane-based surface additives in modern low-volatile organic content (VOC) architectural coatings. As the industry shifts towards near-zero VOC formulations, these additives offer a highly efficient solution for performance enhancement. The article explains how modifying the structure of polydimethylsiloxane (PDMS) molecules, for example through polyether modifications, allows for the creation of surface control agents that significantly lower surface tension. This improves substrate wetting and provides a range of benefits without the negative environmental impact of traditional chemistries. Key findings demonstrate that specific siloxane additives can markedly improve early block resistance, stain resistance, and scuff resistance, particularly in higher pigment volume concentration (PVC) systems. The study utilized commercial products from Evonik's TEGO¬Æ Glide and TEGO¬Æ Phobe lines to showcase these improvements in various coating properties.

News.title: AIP Finalizes Purchase of PPG's Architectural Coatings Business in US & Canada
News.summary: American Industrial Partners (AIP), a private equity firm, has officially completed its acquisition of PPG's architectural coatings business for the U.S. and Canada. This major industry transaction, recorded on December 4, 2024, reshapes the competitive landscape of the North American architectural paint market. The deal includes a portfolio of well-known paint brands, manufacturing facilities, and a network of stores. The strategic divestment by PPG allows the company to focus on its industrial and performance coatings segments, while AIP gains a significant foothold in the decorative coatings sector. This move is expected to lead to shifts in market strategy, brand positioning, and supply chain operations for the acquired business under its new ownership, impacting competitors and consumers alike.

News.title: Wood Coatings Market Projected to Reach $15.18B by 2030
News.summary: A market report from research firm MarketsandMarkets projects that the global wood coatings market will grow to a value of $15.18 billion by the year 2030. This forecast indicates a strong growth trajectory for the sector, likely driven by increasing demand in construction, furniture, and cabinetry. The report, highlighted on January 16, 2025, provides crucial data for strategic planning by manufacturers and suppliers in the wood coatings space. Key factors influencing this growth may include the rising popularity of sustainable and low-VOC formulations, as well as technological advancements in coating durability and aesthetics. This quantitative market insight is vital for stakeholders assessing investment opportunities and market potential over the next several years.

News.title: Micro Powders to Exit PTFE (PFAS) Market by End of 2025
News.summary: Micro Powders, Inc., a key supplier of specialty micronized waxes, has announced its strategic decision to exit the Polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE) market by the end of 2025. This move is significant due to growing regulatory pressures and market concerns surrounding PFAS (per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances), a category to which PTFE belongs. The announcement, dated November 13, 2024, reflects a broader industry trend towards formulating away from 'forever chemicals' in response to environmental and health concerns. This decision will impact coatings formulators who rely on PTFE for properties such as slip, abrasion resistance, and lubricity. The company's transition will likely accelerate the adoption of alternative additives and surface modifiers across the coatings industry.

News.title: AkoTech: An Innovative Coating Platform for Product Protection
News.summary: Microban International has launched AkoTech, a multifunctional coating platform that integrates advanced surface protection with recognized antimicrobial technology. The platform is designed to address the challenge of communicating coating benefits to consumers by combining features like abrasion resistance, chemical repellency, and UV stability with Microban's brand equity in product protection. AkoTech is highly adaptable for numerous industries, including paints, coatings, flooring, furniture, and packaging. The platform streamlines formulation and manufacturing by offering a library of customizable starting-point formulations, ready-to-use coatings, and concentrates. For instance, the CTR-1001 is a durable, water-based coating for hard substrates like concrete and wood. The CTR-1002 is a patent-pending, omniphobic thin coating for glass and metal, while the CTR-1003 concentrate provides a waterproof, antimicrobial barrier for nonwovens and filtration media. This approach aims to reduce R&D time, simplify integration into existing production lines, and enhance product value at the point-of-sale.

News.title: AI and Machine Learning in Coatings and Ink Formulation
News.summary: The coatings and ink industry is beginning to leverage Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) to significantly accelerate product development and innovation. These technologies serve as advanced tools that can drastically reduce the time and resources required for formulation. For instance, instead of conducting hundreds of experiments to optimize a new formulation, AI can narrow the possibilities down to as few as five or ten, providing an optimized starting point. Professor Samiul Amin from the University of Miami, co-founder of FastFormulator Inc., highlights that AI can be used to develop novel sustainable and biodegradable formulations by rapidly analyzing countless combinations of new bio-based materials to meet performance expectations. Beyond formulation, AI systems can monitor evolving regulatory and compliance changes in real-time, suggesting substitutes for newly restricted materials. They can also track intellectual property and patents to provide a competitive edge. While industry adoption remains slow, with a recent study showing only 6% of large companies have integrated AI, the technology is presented not as a replacement for human expertise but as a powerful tool to enhance productivity and allow formulators to focus on innovation.

News.title: Powder Coatings Market Poised for Growth Past 2023
News.summary: The global powder coatings market is expected to surpass $26.3 billion by 2032, according to Global Market Insights. While growth was modest in 2023, industry leaders anticipate future expansion. Sherwin-Williams reported 4-6% global revenue growth in the previous year, with 3-4% in the Americas. AkzoNobel noted a recovery in architectural markets in late 2023 and solid performance in automotive and EV sectors, driven by liquid-to-powder conversion. PPG observed declining volumes in North America and Europe during 2023, while the Asia Pacific region saw slow to moderate growth, particularly in India with an estimated 7% volume increase. Key growth drivers include sustainability regulations, cost efficiency, and performance advantages over liquid coatings, such as enhanced durability and low VOC emissions. The Asia Pacific region is the largest consumer, accounting for 57% of the total market.

News.title: AkzoNobel Launches Advanced Powder Coatings for EVs and Architecture
News.summary: AkzoNobel has introduced several new powder coating technologies. For the electric vehicle (EV) market, a new one-application technology provides high dielectric strength for battery systems. For architecture, Interpon D2525 Low Solar Absorption was launched to reflect solar radiation and reduce heat build-up. The company also partnered with coatingAI to use artificial intelligence to optimize equipment settings, reduce powder consumption, and lower defects. In a push for sustainability, AkzoNobel released low-energy cure products, including Interpon D Low-E for architectural use and Interpon 700/610 Low-E for industrial applications. These coatings can cure at temperatures as low as 150¬∞C, reducing energy consumption by up to 20% or increasing line productivity by up to 25%.

News.title: PPG Unveils High-Performance Primers and Dielectric Coatings
News.summary: PPG has launched several new powder coatings focused on performance and safety. The PPG PRIMERON Optimal is a patent-pending, optimized zinc-rich epoxy primer that provides superior corrosion protection, surpassing 10,000 hours of salt spray testing on blasted steel while offering higher transfer efficiency than standard zinc-rich primers. For the EV market, PPG introduced Envirocron Extreme Protection Thermally Conductive Dielectric Powder Coating, engineered to enhance battery safety, performance, and cooling efficiency. Additionally, PPG Coraflon Platinum is a breakthrough FGIA/AAMA 2605-compliant powder for aluminum extrusions, offering over 20% better transfer efficiency, single-coat corrosion protection, and availability in specialty effects. It is formulated without major substances of concern like VOCs, TGIC, and PFOA.

News.title: Sherwin-Williams Intros Sustainable and High-Edge Powder Coatings
News.summary: Sherwin-Williams has released Powdura ECO, a new sustainable powder coating line that incorporates resins made from recycled plastic (rPET) to promote a circular economy and reduce carbon emissions. The line is available in various formulas and can align with green building certifications like LEED and GREENGUARD. The company is also expanding its High Edge powder portfolio, designed to deliver advanced edge coverage and corrosion resistance for heavy equipment and transportation markets. This technology adjusts particle flow to better coat sharp corners. The portfolio includes a patented Dust-on-Dust technology that cures the primer and topcoat in a single step for improved adhesion and efficiency, as well as a new High Edge direct-to-metal (DTM) powder to further streamline the application process.

News.title: Introduction to Isocyanates in Coatings
News.summary: This article provides a fundamental overview of isocyanates and their use in coatings, with a focus on self-leveling urethane systems. It covers the different types of isocyanates, their properties, and their reactivity. The author, Mike Praw, explains key formulation considerations for achieving desired coating characteristics. The article is the first part of a series, suggesting that more in-depth topics will be covered in future publications. This piece is relevant for formulators and chemists in the coatings industry who want to deepen their understanding of urethane chemistry and its practical applications.

News.title: Solving the Low-Temperature-Cure Powder Coating Puzzle
News.summary: Advancements in low-temperature-cure powder coatings are explored in this article. It discusses the current challenges in formulation and manufacturing, as well as innovative solutions for improving the efficiency and performance of these coatings. The author, Nathan Biller, delves into the technical hurdles and potential breakthroughs that could expand the applications of powder coatings to heat-sensitive substrates. The article highlights the industry's push towards more energy-efficient and sustainable coating processes, making it a significant topic for manufacturers and researchers in the powder coatings sector.

News.title: Vibrantz Unveils a New Solid Tinting System
News.summary: In an interview with Peter Thommassen, R&D Manager at Vibrantz, a new volumetric, solid tinting system is introduced. This innovative system is presented as a sustainable and efficient alternative for tinting both architectural and industrial coatings. The article discusses how this technology can improve performance while offering environmental benefits. This development is particularly relevant for paint manufacturers seeking to enhance their tinting processes, reduce waste, and meet growing demands for sustainable solutions in the coatings industry. The interview format provides direct insights from the company developing the technology.

News.title: Effectiveness of Controlled-Release Preservatives in Europe
News.summary: This article reports on field testing of broad-spectrum, encapsulated dry-film preservatives in various European locations. The study, co-authored by Dr. Joerg Wilken, Dr. Thomas Heuer, and Geoff Clay, confirms the long-term effectiveness of these preservatives against fungal and algal growth. The results show that the tested formulations outperform competing products under diverse environmental conditions. This research is important for manufacturers of exterior coatings and EIFS (Exterior Insulation and Finish Systems) who need to ensure the durability and longevity of their products in challenging climates.

News.title: The Role of Data and AI in the Future of Coatings
News.summary: This article discusses the practical impact of artificial intelligence (AI) on the coatings industry, moving beyond the hype to focus on real-world applications. The author, Ralph J. Woerheide, suggests that decision-makers should concentrate on the outcomes of AI implementation in areas such as R&D, production, and quality control. The piece advocates for a 'smart paint factory' approach, where data-driven insights can lead to significant improvements in efficiency and innovation. The article is a call to action for industry leaders to strategically integrate AI and data analytics into their operations to stay competitive.

News.title: LANXESS Develops Pigments for Low-Carbon-Footprint Coatings
News.summary: Raw material suppliers like LANXESS are contributing to the development of low-emission coatings. This article highlights new iron oxide yellow pigments specifically designed to reduce the carbon footprint of coating formulations. The piece explains how these advanced pigments can help manufacturers meet sustainability goals without compromising on color and performance. This innovation is a direct response to the growing demand for environmentally friendly products in the coatings industry and is relevant for formulators and product stewards focused on sustainability.

News.title: Sustainability and Innovation in the Coatings Industry
News.summary: The coatings industry is at a crossroads, facing significant sustainability challenges while also being a hub of innovation. This article explores the dual landscape of regulatory pressures and technological advancements. It covers a range of topics, from the development of PFAS-free alternatives and low-carbon raw materials to regulatory-driven changes that are shaping the future of coatings. The article provides a broad overview of the key trends and is a must-read for anyone interested in the strategic direction of the coatings industry, from R&D to marketing and management.

News.title: Micro Powders Launches PFAS-Free Texture Additive
News.summary: Micro Powders has introduced MicroTex¬Æ 950, a new texture additive for powder coatings designed as a replacement for PTFE. This launch is a direct response to the increasing demand for PFAS-free materials in the industry. The product is aimed at formulators looking to create textured powder coatings without the environmental and health concerns associated with fluorinated compounds. This announcement is significant for the powder coatings market, as it provides a new tool for developing more sustainable and compliant products. The article highlights the company's commitment to innovation in the face of evolving regulations.

News.title: Aesthetix Tool for Advanced Surface Characterization
News.summary: A new tool called Aesthetix has been launched for the comprehensive analysis of surface characteristics. This instrument measures gloss, texture, and color, providing a more complete picture of a coating's appearance. It is designed to help manufacturers and QC professionals to better quantify and control the aesthetic qualities of their products. For the coatings industry, where appearance is often a key performance indicator, this tool offers a more objective and data-driven approach to surface characterization, potentially leading to improved product consistency and quality.

News.title: New Transparent Heat-Reflecting Coating for Buildings
News.summary: A new transparent coating has been developed to improve the energy efficiency of buildings. By reflecting heat, the coating helps to reduce heat loss in colder climates and heat gain in warmer climates, all while maintaining the aesthetic appearance of the building's surfaces. This product is part of a growing trend of 'cool coatings' and other energy-saving technologies in the architectural coatings market. It is particularly relevant for architects, builders, and homeowners looking for ways to reduce energy consumption and improve the sustainability of their buildings.

News.title: ROSS Introduces New Dual Shaft Mixer for Industrial Use
News.summary: ROSS has launched the FDA-600 Dual Shaft Mixer, a new piece of equipment designed for mixing high-viscosity materials. With a 600-gallon capacity, this mixer is suitable for robust industrial applications, including the manufacturing of paints, coatings, adhesives, and sealants. The dual-shaft design ensures thorough and efficient mixing of even the most challenging formulations. This product announcement is of interest to production managers and process engineers in the coatings industry who are looking to upgrade their manufacturing capabilities and improve their production efficiency.

News.title: X-Rite's New Judge LED Light Booth for Color Evaluation
News.summary: X-Rite has unveiled its new Judge LED light booth, a tool designed to facilitate the transition to LED-based color evaluation. As lighting standards evolve, it is crucial for brands and manufacturers to have a consistent and reliable way to evaluate color under different light sources. The Judge LED booth provides a controlled environment for this purpose, helping to ensure color harmony across the supply chain. This is particularly important for the coatings industry, where color accuracy is critical for applications ranging from automotive finishes to architectural paints.

News.title: Flowsense Technology for Digital Powder Coating Control
News.summary: A new technology called Flowsense has been introduced to bring digital intelligence to the powder coating process. This upgrade offers precise control over powder output, which helps to reduce waste and ensure a consistent coating thickness. By optimizing the application process, Flowsense can lead to significant cost savings and quality improvements for powder coaters. This innovation is part of the broader Industry 4.0 trend, where digital technologies are being integrated into manufacturing processes to enhance control and efficiency. It is relevant for any company involved in powder coating application.

News.title: ACA Report on Durability of Waterborne Coatings
News.summary: The American Coatings Association (ACA) Science and Technology Committee released its third Technology Roadmap in February 2024, focusing on improving the durability and water resistance of waterborne coatings. The report highlights the growing demand for these coatings due to sustainability trends and stricter VOC regulations. It outlines several key technical challenges facing the industry, including issues with film formation, dry/open time, flash rust on metal substrates, adhesion to various surfaces, hydrophilicity leading to blistering, and freeze-thaw stability during transport and storage. Based on expert interviews and consensus-building, the roadmap provides seven core recommendations for future research and industry action. These include: 1) Developing improved, non-destructive, and predictive test methods. 2) Researching higher crosslink density and two-component (2K) waterborne systems for harsher environments. 3) Achieving greater system robustness through novel resins, additives, and surfactants. 4) Improving packaging to maintain product integrity. 5) Enhancing training for applicators on proper surface preparation and handling. 6) Sharing success stories to increase market acceptance. 7) Updating product specifications to focus on performance rather than specific chemistries, allowing for the adoption of new technologies.

News.title: Beckers Group 2024 Company Profile and Financials
News.summary: Beckers Group, a privately held company founded in 1865 and based in Berlin, Germany, reported annual revenues of $663 million. The company is the global market leader in coil coatings, which represent 87% of its sales, with industrial coatings making up the remaining 13%. The firm is guided by a key executive team including Christophe Sabas as CEO. With a global footprint spanning 23 locations in 18 countries, Beckers employs approximately 1,669 people. A core part of the company's strategy is its focus on sustainability, with the stated vision of becoming the most sustainable industrial coatings company worldwide. Its main markets served are industrial coatings, coil coatings, and consumer design finishes.

News.title: Beckers Group Restructures Leadership to Drive Strategic Ambition
News.summary: Beckers Group announced a strategic reorganization of its regional leadership to support its 'Green Lights Strategy,' effective July 1, 2024. The changes are designed to enhance global growth and operational excellence. The new appointments include Eric Fouissac as President for Asia & Middle East, Pia G√∂tze as President for a new Europe & Africa region, and Jared Ireland as Senior Vice President for the newly formed Americas region. This restructuring follows the company's updated purpose and vision, launched in March 2024. The initiative aims to capitalize on business development opportunities, particularly in sustainability and market share growth within its Coil and Industrial Coatings divisions, to reinforce its market leadership position.

News.title: 2025 CEO Forum: Global Coatings Leaders on Market Trends & Strategy
News.summary: In the 2025 CEO Forum, leaders from top global coatings companies including AkzoNobel, BASF, Benjamin Moore, Hempel, and Berger Paints shared their perspectives on market performance and future strategies. The consensus for 2024 was a year of mixed results, with varied performance across different regions and sectors. For instance, AkzoNobel reported solid growth in Latin America and Southeast Asia but faced weakness in China's decorative paint market. Geopolitical tensions and macroeconomic instability were cited as significant challenges, although the impact of proposed tariffs is expected to be mitigated by localized production strategies. Key growth opportunities for 2025 are identified in marine, protective, and powder coatings, as well as in the construction chemicals sector, particularly in burgeoning markets. A universal theme is the strategic pivot towards sustainability, with R&D efforts heavily focused on developing eco-friendly, low-VOC, and bio-based products, alongside specialized coatings for the green energy sector like EV batteries and solar panels. Companies are also investing in digitalization and operational efficiency to navigate an uncertain economic climate and drive profitable growth.

News.title: Wanhua Chemical's Innovations in Coatings: A Q&A with Dr. Weiqi Hua
News.summary: In a detailed interview, Dr. Weiqi Hua, Executive Vice President of Wanhua Chemical, shared insights into the company's strategic focus on the coatings sector. For 2024, Wanhua's total R&D investment surpassed 4.5 billion yuan, involving over 4,700 personnel. The company has launched over 400 coating raw material solutions, emphasizing innovation and environmental protection. Key technological breakthroughs include a unique solvent-free technology that achieves 'zero' VOC and 'zero' SVOC emissions. Wanhua has also developed new products like low-viscosity and fast-drying isocyanate curing agents for automotive and industrial coatings, and a blocked isocyanate (WANNATE¬Æ ITBL) certified for food contact applications. The company is advancing its bio-based portfolio, offering products such as bio-based PDI with over 71% bio-carbon content and various bio-based acrylic and polyurethane emulsions with bio-content ranging from 31% to 55% for wood and architectural coatings. In digitalization, Wanhua launched its AI-powered 'Materials Intelligent Assistant' in 2024 to enhance customer support. The company helps customers achieve sustainability through water-based systems, process optimization, and developing materials for new energy applications, including wind turbine blades and electric vehicle components.

News.title: Michelin Announces Construction of an Industrial Demonstrator
News.summary: Michelin has announced the construction of its first industrial demonstration unit for the 5-HMF molecule, a bio-based chemical intermediate. Located on the Osiris platform in P√©age-en-Roussillon, France, the new facility will have an annual production capacity of 3,000 metric tons, making it the largest 5-HMF production site in the world. This development is significant for the coatings industry as 5-HMF can be used to produce PEF, a recyclable polymer with applications in films, textiles, and resins. The availability of this molecule at an industrial scale could lead to new, more sustainable coating formulations and materials, offering enhanced performance characteristics while reducing environmental footprint. The project represents a major step in the commercialization of bio-based chemicals.

News.title: ACCESS Rudolf Signs Agreement with ClearEdge Solutions
News.summary: ACCESS Rudolf Technologies has entered into a distributorship agreement with ClearEdge Solutions. Under this new partnership, ClearEdge Solutions will represent and distribute the RUCOLAC¬Æ coatings additives product line. This portfolio consists of high-performance additives specifically developed for the paints and coatings industry. The agreement is a strategic move aimed at expanding the market presence of Rudolf's products throughout North America. This collaboration is expected to enhance the availability of specialized additives to coatings manufacturers, potentially leading to new product formulations and improved performance in various applications. The partnership leverages ClearEdge's distribution network to strengthen ACCESS Rudolf's footprint in a key regional market.

News.title: DELTA Coatings Breaks Ground on New Headquarters
News.summary: DELTA Coatings International has officially broken ground on its new headquarters located in Dubai Industrial City. The ceremony was attended by senior representatives from both DELTA Coatings and Dubai Industrial City, marking a significant milestone for the company's expansion. This move signals the company's growth and commitment to the region's burgeoning industrial sector. The new headquarters will likely serve as a central hub for its operations, research and development, and customer service, enhancing its capabilities to serve the Middle Eastern and international markets for protective coatings. The development is poised to strengthen the local manufacturing ecosystem and support the continued growth of the coatings industry in the UAE.

News.title: National Coatings Inc. Joins Fenix Specialty Performance Coatings
News.summary: Fenix Specialty Performance Coatings, a manufacturer of industrial paints and concrete coatings, has announced the acquisition of National Coatings Inc. National Coatings is a supplier of high-performance coatings for the general industrial and metal-deco markets. This strategic move expands Fenix's portfolio and market reach, integrating National Coatings' expertise and product lines into its family. The acquisition is expected to create synergies in product development, manufacturing, and distribution, offering customers a broader range of solutions. For the coatings industry, this consolidation represents a trend towards specialized market leadership and expanded capabilities, particularly in high-performance and industrial application segments.

News.title: Gelest Completes New Production Facility in Morrisville, PA
News.summary: Gelest, Inc., a key supplier of specialty silicones, organosilanes, metal-organics, and acrylate monomers, has opened a new 50,000-square-foot production facility at its global headquarters in Morrisville, Pennsylvania. The facility, built on a revitalized U.S. EPA Brownfield site, significantly expands Gelest's production capabilities. This expansion will support advanced technology end markets, including coatings and adhesives, by increasing the supply of critical materials for applications ranging from microelectronics and medical devices to advanced thermal coatings and mobility. The increased capacity is poised to benefit the coatings industry by ensuring a stable supply of high-performance raw materials necessary for innovation and production of next-generation coatings and adhesives with specialized functionalities.

News.title: ACA Promotes Inaugural World Paint and Coatings Week
News.summary: The American Coatings Association (ACA) announced its participation in the inaugural World Paint and Coatings Week, which ran from March 24 to March 28, 2025. The ACA joined the World Coatings Council and other global paint and coatings associations and companies in this initiative. The event was launched across social media channels to raise awareness and celebrate the industry's contributions. This global campaign aimed to highlight the importance and benefits of paints and coatings in daily life, from protecting infrastructure and homes to enabling technological advancements. By participating, the ACA reinforced its role in the international coatings community and worked to promote a positive public image of the industry, emphasizing innovation, sustainability, and economic value on a global scale.

News.title: ACA's New Global Market Analysis for the Paint & Coatings Industry Now Available
News.summary: The American Coatings Association (ACA) has released its latest 'Global Market Analysis for the Paint & Coatings Industry (2024‚Äì2029)'. This comprehensive report provides quantitative and qualitative data analysis for the $202 billion global coatings industry, including five-year projections for performance across various sectors and segments. The analysis serves as a critical resource for strategic planning, offering insights into market trends, growth areas, and potential challenges. For companies in the coatings value chain, this report is an essential tool for understanding the global landscape, identifying opportunities, and making informed business decisions to drive future growth. It covers key market dynamics that will shape the industry over the next five years.

News.title: Gehring Montgomery Reports Record 2024 Sales and Positive 2025 Outlook
News.summary: Gehring Montgomery achieved a record-breaking sales year in 2024, largely attributed to the merger of Strohmeyer and Keim-Additec Surface USA, which enabled the company to penetrate new market segments. The U.S. coatings additives market is forecasted to expand from $8.72 billion in 2024 to $11.04 billion by 2029. The company has expanded its portfolio with premium products including Ceronas waxes, CHT water-based and silicone emulsions, and Kuraray MOWITAL PVB. For 2025, Gehring Montgomery anticipates continued growth, supported by a projected 2.3% expansion in the overall coatings industry. The company feels well-prepared to handle potential tariff challenges due to its manufacturing bases in the USA and Europe. In collaboration with key producers, the company is set to introduce advanced technologies in 2025 and 2026, focusing on graphene technology and novel synthetic and natural emulsions, which have shown exceptional performance in initial client trials.

News.title: Micro Powders Sees Strong 2024 Growth, Focuses on PTFE-Free Additives
News.summary: Micro Powders, Inc. experienced robust sales growth in 2024 as customers returned to normal ordering patterns following a period of destocking in 2023. A significant portion of this growth was driven by the company's new range of PTFE-free products. The primary market factor for 2025 is the impending discontinuation of PTFE-based additive powders, a market segment Micro Powders and other suppliers will exit by the end of the year. The company is optimistic about 2025, having successfully converted many customers to its PTFE-replacement products. These next-generation additives utilize a unique technology combining hard, inert materials like aluminum oxide and ceramics with various wax materials. Performance data indicates that these innovative products often outperform traditional PTFE composite wax technology in terms of lubricity, scratch, and abrasion resistance, frequently at a lower cost, positioning the company for continued growth.

News.title: Munzing Addresses Regulatory Challenges with Greener Additive Solutions
News.summary: In 2024, Munzing focused on navigating regulatory changes and addressing the industry-wide shortage of skilled formulators by expanding its team of experienced chemists. The company's technical service laboratory has been a key differentiator, providing crucial support to customers facing formulation challenges. Looking ahead to 2025, Munzing anticipates that stricter environmental regulations, the demand for sustainable and bio-based options, and supply chain volatility will remain key challenges. To mitigate these issues, Munzing leverages its six strategically located global manufacturing sites. The company's research and development efforts are concentrated on creating 'cleaner and greener' products. This includes a new portfolio of additives based on bio-renewable raw materials that are PTFE-free, mineral oil-free, and free of microplastics, designed to meet or exceed the performance of older, regulated technologies.

News.title: Shamrock Technologies Highlights Innovation Driven by Compliance Demands
News.summary: Shamrock Technologies reported a solid business year for additives in 2024, noting that regulatory and safety compliance acted as a primary driver for innovation and the commercialization of new additive technologies. The company foresees that regulatory shifts, tariffs, and supply chain disruptions will persist as significant factors in 2025, creating both challenges for established suppliers and entry opportunities for new ones. Shamrock expects overall market growth in 2025 as tariff situations gain clarity and supply chain dynamics normalize. As a leader in micronized polymer solutions, including waxes and PTFE, the company is focused on developing sustainable and eco-friendly formulations. Recent advancements include water-based coatings and PFAS-free alternatives designed to meet stringent regulatory requirements while enhancing coating durability, scratch resistance, and UV stability, thereby supporting both functionality and environmental sustainability.

News.title: Michelin to Build Industrial Demonstrator for 5-HMF Molecule
News.summary: Michelin has announced the construction of its first industrial demonstration unit for the 5-HMF molecule in P√©age-en-Roussillon, France. This new facility is set to become the largest production site for 5-HMF globally, with an anticipated annual production capacity of 3,000 metric tons. The 5-HMF molecule has applications in various industries, including the development of advanced materials and bio-based chemicals that can be used in coatings formulations. This move signals a significant investment in sustainable chemistry and bio-based materials, which could impact the raw material supply chain for the coatings industry.

News.title: ACCESS Rudolf Partners with ClearEdge for Coatings Additives
News.summary: ACCESS Rudolf Technologies has entered into a distributorship agreement with ClearEdge Solutions. Through this partnership, ClearEdge Solutions will market and distribute the RUCOLAC¬Æ coatings additives product line in North America. The RUCOLAC portfolio consists of high-performance additives designed specifically for the paints and coatings sector. This strategic alliance aims to broaden the market reach of Rudolf's products, providing North American coatings manufacturers with greater access to specialized additives that can enhance product performance and application properties.

News.title: DELTA Coatings Begins Construction on New Dubai Headquarters
News.summary: DELTA Coatings has officially broken ground on its new corporate headquarters located in Dubai Industrial City. The groundbreaking ceremony was attended by senior leadership from both DELTA Coatings International and Dubai Industrial City. This expansion reflects the company's growth and commitment to the region's burgeoning industrial sector. The new headquarters will likely enhance the company's operational efficiency and support its continued development of coatings for various industrial applications in the Middle East.

News.title: Gelest Opens New 50,000 sq. ft. Production Facility in PA
News.summary: Gelest, Inc., a key supplier of specialty silicones, organosilanes, and other materials for high-tech markets like coatings and adhesives, has opened a new 50,000-square-foot production facility. Located at its Morrisville, Pennsylvania headquarters on a redeveloped U.S. EPA Brownfield site, the expansion significantly increases Gelest's manufacturing capacity. This will support the production of advanced materials for a range of applications, including microelectronics, medical devices, and advanced thermal coatings, indicating a growing demand for high-performance materials in the coatings industry.

News.title: David Fairhurst Wins 2025 CoatingsTech Best Paper Award
News.summary: Dr. David Fairhurst, president of Colloid Consultants, Ltd., received the American Coatings Association's (ACA) 2025 CoatingsTech Best Paper Award. The award was presented at the 2025 CoatingsTech Conference for his paper on using Low Field (LF)-NMR Relaxation as a technique for quality control and determining material equivalency in coatings formulations. The paper, co-authored by researchers from Mageleka Inc. and Metromation Inc., highlights an innovative analytical method that could improve consistency and efficiency in coatings manufacturing by providing a new way to assess raw materials.

News.title: ACA Releases New Global Market Analysis for Paint & Coatings
News.summary: The American Coatings Association (ACA) has launched its new Global Market Analysis for the Paint & Coatings Industry (2024‚Äì2029). This comprehensive report provides quantitative and qualitative data analysis for the $202 billion global coatings industry, including five-year performance projections by sector and segment. It serves as a critical strategic planning resource for businesses, offering insights into market trends, growth areas, and potential challenges. The analysis is designed to help coatings companies identify opportunities and make informed decisions about future investments and market positioning.

News.title: Global Pigments Market Rebounds Amid Regulatory and Eco-Driven Shifts
News.summary: The global pigments market is showing a strong rebound in 2024 after a lull in 2023, with market size estimated at $31.08 billion in 2025 and projected to reach $35.68 billion by 2030, growing at a CAGR of over 2.8%. Key drivers include a stabilizing supply chain and strong demand from the architectural and industrial coatings sectors. A significant trend is the shift towards sustainability and high-performance pigments (HPP). Companies are adapting to new regulations, such as those concerning PFAS, which has increased demand for highly-engineered inorganic pigments in applications like cookware. For example, Shepherd Color is highlighting its FDA-compliant CICP pigments. Trust Chem announced the opening of a new plant in China to supply HPP and azo pigments. However, the industry faces regulatory headwinds in the U.S. The Color Pigments Manufacturers Association (CPMA) has voiced concerns over costly regulations, specifically citing the EPA's proposed draft rule for CI Pigment Violet 29, published on December 20, 2024. Sustainability remains a major focus, particularly in Europe, with companies pursuing EcoVadis ratings and developing eco-friendly products like IR reflective pigments to improve energy efficiency.

Patents.title: New Patent for Ergonomic Paint Can Handle to Reduce Spills
Patents.summary: An editor's viewpoint highlights a new patent for an ergonomic grip for paint can handles. This innovation aims to reduce paint spills, a common problem that leads to material loss, safety risks, and operational inefficiencies in retail and professional settings. The article argues that even small innovations like this can have a significant impact on the industry. This patent is relevant for companies involved in paint packaging and logistics, as well as for retailers and end-users who stand to benefit from a safer and more user-friendly design. It's an example of how innovation can address practical, everyday challenges in the coatings value chain.

Conference.title: Coatings Trends & Technologies Summit 2025
Conference.summary: The Coatings Trends & Technologies (CTT) Summit is an annual conference scheduled for September 3, 2025. This event brings together formulators and manufacturers of both liquid and powder coatings to discuss the latest innovations in coatings technology. The summit features high-quality technical presentations, an exhibit hall, and networking opportunities to foster collaboration and the development of new ideas in the coatings industry. The 2025 summit will also offer four short courses for interactive learning.

Conference.title: Registration Opens for the Eastern Coatings Show 2025
Conference.summary: Registration is now officially open for the Eastern Coatings Show, a significant event for the coatings industry in North America. This conference provides a critical platform for raw material suppliers, equipment manufacturers, and formulators to connect, share innovations, and discuss market trends. The event is scheduled to feature technical presentations, exhibits from leading companies, and networking opportunities for professionals across the paint and coatings value chain. This announcement, dated January 22, 2025, signals an important upcoming opportunity for industry stakeholders to gain insights into new technologies, regulatory updates, and market forecasts. The show's focus is on fostering collaboration and business development within the coatings community.

Conference.title: Coatings Trends & Technologies Summit 2025
Conference.summary: The Coatings Trends & Technologies (CTT) Summit is an annual conference scheduled for September 3, 2025. This event brings together formulators and manufacturers of both liquid and powder coatings to discuss the latest innovations in coatings technology. The summit features high-quality technical presentations, an exhibit hall, and networking opportunities. This year, the summit is expanding its offerings with four short courses, providing an extensive day of interactive learning. This conference is a key event for professionals in the coatings industry who want to stay abreast of new technologies and network with peers.

Conference.title: SSCT Annual Meeting and Technology Conference
Conference.summary: The Southern Society for Coatings Technology (SSCT) held its Annual Meeting and Technology Conference from June 2 to June 5, 2024. This event took place at The Vinoy Resort & Golf Club in St. Petersburg, Florida. The conference served as a key gathering for professionals within the coatings industry, focusing on technological advancements and industry trends. Spanning four days, it provided a platform for industry experts to network, present research, and discuss new developments in coatings technology. The event was specifically targeted at the coatings sector, aiming to foster collaboration and knowledge sharing among its members.

Conference.title: Waterborne Symposium Issues 2025 Call For Papers
Conference.summary: The University of Southern Mississippi has announced a call for papers for the 53rd Annual International Waterborne, High-Solids and Powder Coatings Symposium, scheduled for February 8-13, 2026. This five-day event aims to bring together coatings formulators, chemists, managers, suppliers, students, and educators to discuss the latest advancements in coatings science and technology. The organizing committee is seeking submissions of original, non-commercial research from academic, government, and industry professionals. Abstracts are due by September 1, 2025, with acceptance letters sent by October 1, 2025. Final written papers for the proceedings are required by December 1, 2025. Presentations are scheduled for February 11-13, 2026. Suggested topics cover a wide range of innovations, including novel waterborne materials, powder coatings, nanotechnology, protective coatings, renewable bio-based coatings, the integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI), and sustainable solutions. The event serves as a key academic forum for disseminating and examining new research, methodologies, and commercial strategies in the coatings industry.

Conference.title: RadTech 2025 Conference Issues Call for Papers on UV/EB Tech
Conference.summary: RadTech International North America has opened its Call for Papers for the RadTech 2025 UV&EB Technology Conference, a premier event focusing on sustainable manufacturing solutions with UV+EB technology. The conference is scheduled to take place from May 18-21, 2025, at the Detroit Marriott at the Renaissance Center in Detroit, Michigan. Industry leaders and professionals are invited to submit abstracts on the latest advancements in UV+EB technology, which is highly relevant to the radcure coatings sector. The deadline for abstract submission is October 11, 2024. This event provides a significant platform for sharing innovations in coatings, adhesives, and other applications within the industry, bringing together experts to discuss new developments and market trends.

Conference.title: World Coatings Council Discusses Global Issues at 2024 Meeting
Conference.summary: In March 2024, the World Coatings Council (WCC) convened its Annual Meeting in Shanghai, hosted by the Chinese National Coatings Industry Association (CNCIA). The council's agenda covered a wide range of administrative and policy matters, including in-depth reports on global sustainability initiatives and updates on UN meetings related to the Transport of Dangerous Goods, the Globally Harmonized System (GHS), and the International Maritime Organization. Key environmental and regulatory topics discussed included plastics and microplastics, the EU Green Deal, extended producer responsibility (EPR) schemes, and emerging restrictions on PFAS and biocides. At the meeting, the WCC recognized Tom Bowtell of the British Coatings Federation as its new President. The council also resolved to establish a ‚ÄúGlobal Coatings Day‚Äù starting in 2025 to promote the industry's value and agreed to pilot an Advocacy Leaders Council to help formulate unified positions on critical global issues.

Conference.title: World Coatings Council Announces 2024 Coatings Summit in Singapore
Conference.summary: The World Coatings Council (WCC) has announced plans to hold its 2024 Coatings Summit in Singapore. The decision was part of the discussions at the council's annual meeting. Further deliberation centered on the logistics and viability of scheduling the WCC Annual Meeting to occur immediately after the conclusion of the Coatings Summit. As of the announcement date, the final schedule for these events was still being developed. This initiative aims to streamline major international gatherings for the global coatings industry, potentially increasing participation and collaboration among its international members.

Conference.title: RadTech 2024 Looks at Bright Future of Energy Curing
Conference.summary: RadTech 2024, held in Orlando, highlighted sustainability as the primary driver for the adoption of energy curing technologies like UV, UV LED, and Electron Beam (EB). The conference, themed ‚ÄúToday‚Äôs Choices, Tomorrow‚Äôs Future: UV+EB for Sustainable & Responsible Manufacturing,‚Äù featured over 90 presentations covering advancements and new applications. Key discussions focused on the growing demand for matte finishes using excimer UV curing, the development of PFAS-free stain-resistant UV coatings for wood, and innovations in recyclable flexible packaging through EB processing. The event underscored significant opportunities in the coil coatings market, with major players like AkzoNobel and Beckers Group discussing their transition to radiation curing, citing performance and a strong ROI. The packaging industry was also a central topic, with speakers from PepsiCo and The Pok√©mon Company, the latter of which reported a 50% reduction in customer complaints about scratched cards after switching to UV coatings. A regulatory town hall addressed the complexities of differing state and international rules, emphasizing the need for industry involvement in policymaking. The conference was marked by high attendance and positive feedback, signaling strong growth and innovation within the energy curing sector.

Conference.title: David Fairhurst Receives ACA's 2025 CoatingsTech Best Paper Award
Conference.summary: At the 2025 CoatingsTech Conference, the American Coatings Association (ACA) presented its Best Paper Award to David Fairhurst, Ph.D., president of Colloid Consultants, Ltd. The award recognized his paper titled, ‚ÄúLow Field (LF)-NMR Relaxation ‚Äì A Useful Technique for QC and to Determine the Equivalency of Materials for Coatings Formulations.‚Äù The paper was co-authored by Ravi Sharma, Ph.D., of Mageleka Inc., and Ralph Jan W√∂rheide of Metromation Inc. This work highlights an innovative analytical technique using low-field nuclear magnetic resonance (LF-NMR) for quality control in coatings. The technique offers a new method for assessing material equivalency, which is critical for formulation adjustments and raw material sourcing, promising to enhance consistency and performance in coatings production.

Conference.title: Dr. Lipiin Sung to Deliver Mattiello Lecture at 2025 CoatingsTech Conference
Conference.summary: Dr. Lipiin Sung, a distinguished research physicist and project leader at the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), has been selected to deliver the prestigious Mattiello Memorial Lecture at the American Coatings Association's (ACA) 2025 CoatingsTech Conference. Dr. Sung's work is in the Infrastructure Materials Group of the Materials and Structural Systems Division of the Engineering Laboratory at NIST. Her selection signifies the high caliber of technical expertise and research that will be presented at the conference. The Mattiello lecture is a cornerstone of the event, traditionally delivered by an individual who has made outstanding contributions to the science and technology of the coatings industry. Her presentation is expected to provide valuable insights into materials science and its application to next-generation coatings.

Conference.title: Andrea Wagner Watts to Keynote ACA's 2025 CoatingsTech Conference
Conference.summary: Andrea Wagner Watts, the building science education manager at GAF, will deliver the keynote address at the American Coatings Association's (ACA) 2025 CoatingsTech Conference. The conference, a leading technical event for the industry, is scheduled for April 28-30 in Pittsburgh, PA, under the theme ‚ÄúCoatings and Technologies for a Resilient Future.‚Äù As a keynote speaker from a major building materials manufacturer, Watts is expected to provide valuable insights into the intersection of building science and coatings technology. Her address will likely cover topics such as energy efficiency, durability, and the role of coatings in creating resilient infrastructure, setting the tone for a conference focused on innovation and future challenges.

Conference.title: Dr. Lipiin Sung to Give Mattiello Lecture at CoatingsTech 2025
Conference.summary: Dr. Lipiin Sung, a research physicist at the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), has been selected to deliver the prestigious Mattiello Memorial Lecture at the American Coatings Association's (ACA) 2025 CoatingsTech Conference. Dr. Sung is a project leader in the Infrastructure Materials Group within the Engineering Laboratory at NIST. Her lecture is a key highlight of the conference, which is a premier technical event for the coatings industry, bringing together scientists and industry experts to discuss the latest research and innovations shaping the future of coatings technology.

Conference.title: GAF's Andrea Wagner Watts to Keynote at CoatingsTech 2025
Conference.summary: Andrea Wagner Watts, the building science education manager at GAF, will be the keynote speaker at the American Coatings Association's (ACA) 2025 CoatingsTech Conference. The conference, a leading technical event for the industry, is scheduled for April 28-30 in Pittsburgh, PA. The theme for the event is ‚ÄúCoatings and Technologies for a Resilient Future.‚Äù Watts's keynote will likely address key trends in building science and the role of advanced coatings in creating durable and sustainable infrastructure, providing valuable insights for attendees from across the coatings value chain.

Legalnews.title: CEPE Disagrees with European Commission's TiO2 Antidumping Duties
Legalnews.summary: The European Council for the Paint, Printing Ink and Artists' Colours Industry (CEPE) has voiced its disagreement with the European Commission's decision to impose definitive anti-dumping duties on titanium dioxide (TiO2) originating from China. This regulatory development has significant implications for the European coatings market, as TiO2 is a critical white pigment used extensively across the industry for opacity and durability. The duties are expected to impact raw material sourcing, pricing, and supply chain strategies for coatings manufacturers operating in the region. The decision, published on January 13, 2025, follows an investigation into the alleged dumping of the pigment, a move that could reshape competitive dynamics and influence production costs for many companies reliant on Chinese TiO2 imports.

Legalnews.title: PFAS-Free Antistatic Coatings for LCD Polarizers
Legalnews.summary: With increasing regulations against PFAS materials, this article presents antimony-doped tin oxide (ATO)-based antistatic coatings as a viable alternative. The author, Roel Huis in 't Veld, compares ATO-based coatings with PEDOT and other fluorinated additives, highlighting their superior performance and stability, particularly in pressure-sensitive adhesives (PSAs) for LCD polarizers. The article emphasizes that these PFAS-free coatings effectively prevent static discharge, a critical issue in electronics manufacturing. This development is crucial for companies looking to comply with new environmental regulations while maintaining high product performance.

Legalnews.title: ACA Urges TPLF Act Inclusion in Congressional Reconciliation Package
Legalnews.summary: The American Coatings Association (ACA) is actively advocating for the inclusion of the 'TPLF Act' in a forthcoming Congressional reconciliation package. This legislative push is part of ACA's broader engagement on judicial, regulatory, and legislative issues at federal, state, and local levels. The association represents the interests of the U.S. paint and coatings industry, a significant sector of the economy. This action underscores the ACA's commitment to shaping policy and legal frameworks that impact its members, addressing critical issues that can affect the industry's operations, market access, and compliance requirements. The outcome of this advocacy could have substantial implications for the financial and operational landscape of coatings manufacturers across the United States, influencing everything from litigation risks to regulatory burdens.

Legalnews.title: ACA Comments on New York Senate Bill 1464
Legalnews.summary: The American Coatings Association (ACA) has submitted formal comments regarding New York Senate Bill 1464. This action is part of the ACA's ongoing advocacy efforts to represent the interests of the paint and coatings industry in state-level legislative matters. The specific details of the bill and ACA's position were not fully elaborated in the provided text, but the intervention itself is significant. It highlights the proactive stance the association takes in monitoring and influencing legislation that could impact manufacturing, product formulation, labeling, or sale of coatings within New York state. Such advocacy is crucial for ensuring that regulations are reasonable, technically feasible, and do not unduly burden the industry, thereby affecting both manufacturers and consumers of paint and coatings products.

Legalnews.title: SCAQMD Public Hearing on Solvent Cleaning Operations Rule
Legalnews.summary: California's South Coast Air Quality Management District (SCAQMD) scheduled a public hearing for June 6, 2025, to discuss Proposed Amended Rule 1171, which governs solvent cleaning operations. The district released the draft rule language and a corresponding staff report for public review. This regulatory development is highly relevant to the coatings industry, as many companies utilize solvent cleaning processes for equipment and surface preparation. Any changes to Rule 1171 could impose new limits on volatile organic compound (VOC) emissions, require the use of alternative, lower-VOC solvents, or mandate new equipment and record-keeping practices. These amendments can have a direct impact on the operational costs and compliance strategies for coatings manufacturers and applicators in one of the country's most strictly regulated air districts.

Legalnews.title: ACA Issues Statement on Tariffs Affecting Coatings Industry
Legalnews.summary: The American Coatings Association (ACA) released a statement addressing the negative impact of new tariffs imposed on Canada, Mexico, and China. The ACA argues that these tariffs will disrupt supply chains and increase production costs for essential consumer products that rely on coatings. The statement highlights the broad impact on sectors including medical devices, pharmaceuticals, food production equipment, automotive, and aerospace applications. The ACA's position is that these trade policies will create significant economic headwinds for the U.S. coatings industry, which depends on raw materials and trade relationships with these key partners. The association warns that the increased costs will likely be passed on to consumers, affecting the price and availability of numerous goods.

Legalnews.title: EPA Publishes Preliminary List of Companies for TSCA Risk Evaluation Fees
Legalnews.summary: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has published preliminary lists of manufacturers and importers who may be subject to fee obligations under the Toxic Substances Control Act (TSCA). These fees are associated with EPA-initiated risk evaluations for five High-Priority Substances: Acetaldehyde, Acrylonitrile, Benzenamine, Vinyl chloride, and 4,4‚Ä≤-Methylene bis(2-chloroaniline). Companies that have manufactured or imported these chemicals in the last five years are required to report to the EPA via the CDX platform, regardless of whether they appear on the preliminary list. This action has significant financial and compliance implications for coatings manufacturers who use these substances in their formulations or processes, as they may be required to contribute to the cost of the EPA's risk evaluation.

Legalnews.title: EPA Amends National Aerosol Coatings Rule Following ACA Petition
Legalnews.summary: In response to a petition from the American Coatings Association (ACA), the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has published amendments to the National Aerosol Coatings Rule. This regulatory action is significant as it aligns the federal rule with the California Air Resources Board's (CARB) more stringent aerosol coatings regulations. The harmonization of these rules creates a more consistent regulatory framework across the United States. This will benefit aerosol coatings manufacturers by streamlining compliance efforts and reducing the burden of navigating different standards between federal and California state requirements. The amendments are expected to simplify product distribution and ensure that manufacturers can meet a single, unified standard for VOC content and other regulatory requirements.

Legalnews.title: SCAQMD Workshop on Proposed Amended Rule 1151 (Auto-Refinish)
Legalnews.summary: The South Coast Air Quality Management District (SCAQMD) in California announced a workshop for August 30, 2024, to discuss Proposed Amended Rule 1151, which regulates coatings used in automotive refinishing. The district accepted written comments on the proposal until September 13, 2024, with a governing board hearing anticipated for November 1, 2024. These amendments are critical for the auto-refinish coatings sector, as they will likely introduce stricter volatile organic compound (VOC) limits and other compliance requirements. The changes could necessitate reformulation of products, investment in new application technologies, and adjustments to operational procedures for body shops and suppliers in the district to meet the new air quality standards.

Legalnews.title: ACA Urges Inclusion of TPLF Act in Reconciliation Package
Legalnews.summary: The American Coatings Association (ACA) is advocating for the inclusion of the TPLF (Third-Party Litigation Financing) Act in the upcoming congressional reconciliation package. The ACA's engagement on this legislative issue reflects the industry's concern over litigation practices that can impact business operations and costs. This advocacy effort is part of the ACA's broader strategy to represent the U.S. paint and coatings industry's interests at the federal level, addressing judicial and legislative issues that affect manufacturers and suppliers.

Legalnews.title: SCAQMD Sets Public Hearing for Solvent Cleaning Rule Amendments
Legalnews.summary: California's South Coast Air Quality Management District (SCAQMD) has scheduled a public hearing for June 6 to consider Proposed Amended Rule 1171, which governs solvent cleaning operations. The district has released the draft rule language and staff report for public review. These amendments could have a significant impact on coatings manufacturers and users who rely on solvent-based cleaning processes, potentially requiring changes in materials, equipment, or procedures to comply with new emissions standards. This regulatory update is crucial for companies operating within the SCAQMD's jurisdiction.

Legalnews.title: ACA Issues Statement on Tariffs Affecting Coatings Industry
Legalnews.summary: The American Coatings Association (ACA) released a statement expressing concern over new tariffs imposed on Canada, Mexico, and China. The ACA argues that these tariffs will disrupt supply chains and increase production costs for the paint and coatings industry. As these countries are major trading partners, the financial impact is expected to ripple through to essential consumer products that rely on coatings, including automotive parts, aerospace applications, food production equipment, and medical devices. The statement highlights the potential for these trade policies to negatively affect both manufacturers and consumers.

Legalnews.title: EPA Lists Companies for TSCA Risk Evaluation Fees
Legalnews.summary: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has published preliminary lists of manufacturers and importers who may be required to pay fees for the TSCA risk evaluations of five High-Priority Substances: Acetaldehyde, Acrylonitrile, Benzenamine, Vinyl chloride, and 4,4‚Ä≤-Methylene bis(2-chloroaniline). Companies that have manufactured or imported these chemicals in the last five years must report to the EPA via the CDX portal, regardless of whether they appear on the preliminary lists. The comment period is open until March 3, 2025. This action directly affects chemical suppliers and coatings manufacturers using these substances.

Legalnews.title: EPA Amends National Aerosol Coatings Rule Per ACA Petition
Legalnews.summary: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has finalized amendments to the National Aerosol Coatings Rule, following a petition by the American Coatings Association (ACA). The changes are intended to create a more consistent regulatory framework by aligning the national rule with the aerosol coatings rule established by the California Air Resources Board (CARB). This harmonization is expected to benefit aerosol coatings manufacturers by streamlining compliance obligations and reducing the complexity of navigating different state and federal regulations, thereby simplifying product distribution across the United States.

Legalnews.title: SCAQMD to Hold Workshop on Auto-Refinish Rule (Rule 1151)
Legalnews.summary: The South Coast Air Quality Management District (SCAQMD) in California announced a workshop for August 30 to discuss Proposed Amended Rule 1151, which regulates automotive refinishing operations. The district accepted written comments on the proposal until September 13, 2024. The proposed amendments aim to further reduce VOC emissions from auto-refinish coatings, which could necessitate the development and adoption of new, lower-VOC coating technologies by manufacturers. A public hearing before the Governing Board is anticipated for November 1, subject to change.
